intro: Caroxylon azaurenum, commonly known as the blue tamarind, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pale blue flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Caroxylon azaurenum is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas.
